Matrix-0.1.3.0: A Haskell implementation of Numeric Vectors and Matrices

PortabilityPortable
StabilityStable
Maintainerjackhiggins07@gmail.com
Safe HaskellNone

Math.Vector

Contents

Description

A Haskell implementation of Numeric Vectors and Matrices

This class defines an extension of Vector to introduce numeric operation for vectors. It begins by adding an instance for Num Vector, allowing for numeric vectors to be treated as numbers.

example: let u = 1,2,3 let v = 3,4,5 then u + v = 4,6,8

It also implements common vector functions such as dot and (eventually) cross products.

Operators

(<.>) :: Num a => Vector a -> Vector a -> a

Infix operator for the dot product of two Vectors

Infix operator for perpendicular

(-||) :: (Eq a, Floating a) => Vector a -> Vector a -> Bool

Infix operator for parallel

Multiply a functor (Matrix or Vector) by a scalar

Multiply a functor (Matrix or Vector) by a scalar

Vector a relative to b

Reads a vector from a String in the form x1, .. xn

Angles

Get the angle between two vectors

parallel :: (Eq a, Floating a) => Vector a -> Vector a -> Bool

True when two vectors are parallel May have trouble with rounding errors

perpendicular :: (Eq a, Num a) => Vector a -> Vector a -> Bool

True when two vectors are parallel

Short form of dotProduct

Projection of u onto v
